properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 6 at 1:36AM HST until February 6 at 6:30AM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the

* Flash Flood Warning for...
The island of Kauai in Kauai County

* Until 630 AM HST.

* At 130 AM HST, the Hanalei stream gauge reported a rapid rise in
water level. Flooding is occurring in the vicinity of the Hanalei
River Bridge and along the Hanalei River. The latest observations
shows flood waters are slowly receding at the Hanalei River Bridge
gauge. High waters are expected to drop below flood thresholds at
the gauge location over the next few hours.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.

SOURCE...Stream gage.

IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads,
properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road
closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible
in steep terrain.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Princeville and Hanalei.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring
within the warned area.

Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even
if they are currently dry.

Do not cross fast flowing water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn
around, don't drown.
